meta.title: Baptiste Dauphouy • Portfolio
meta.description: Hello, I am Baptiste Dauphouy, a full-stack developer.

landing.title:
Hello,
I am Baptiste Dauphouy,
a full-stack developer.

projects.title: Shopiette
projects.description: Quickly create e-commerce websites with Svelte.

projects.title: Vintify
projects.description: Easily import your Vinted products into Shopify.

projects.title: Vitaliplay
projects.description: Vitaliplay is a sports platform for seniors.

items.title: September 2018
items.text: Discovered HTML and CSS in the sophomore year of high school.
Created various projects, explored, discovered, and learned JavaScript.

items.title: March 2020
items.text: Got back into coding after a few months break. The lockdown began, and I needed to do something productive with my days instead of playing Fortnite.

items.title: June 2020
items.text: Found my first client who was willing to pay me to develop their site: Flexomatic. Unfortunately, they never paid me :(

items.title: May 2021
items.text: Created my first 'serious' portfolio and purchased my domain bdph.me (which I no longer own).

items.title: September 2021
items.text: Moved from my hometown to Paris, prepared for the new school year, and made the final adjustments to my portfolio.

items.title: November 2021
items.text: First freelance mission for a client who finally paid me! Synerg'hetic, an association at HETIC offering projects to its students, trusted me. The project: Vitaliplay, an online sports platform for seniors. I handled the front-end and chose to use the React stack.

items.title: January 2022
items.text: Worked for a client whose project was to create a social network focused on users' professional skills, targeting developers and designers in particular.

items.title: April 2022
items.text: Created a browser-based RPG with a group as part of a school project. The result impressed the whole class.

items.title: August 2022
items.text: Started my internship at Radio France. My mission: integrate the new components of the Design System. I’m lucky to have the opportunity to work with my favorite stack: Svelte.

items.title: November 2022
items.text: Created a website for my father, who works in construction.

items.title: February 2023
items.text: Byoss contacted me again for the new UI of their social network for developers and designers.

items.title: September 2023
items.text: Created an e-commerce store for a friend who sells Pokémon cards.

items.title: July 2024
items.text: Started developing Shopiette. The idea: a toolkit to develop e-commerce applications with SvelteKit and Tailwind. So far, I’ve mostly made a POC to see how to build the project, but in the future, I plan to create an SDK that allows interaction with Shopify store data, a UI kit built with Tailwind, gathering blocks and components for e-commerce, and a CLI to connect the two and generate a custom theme.

items.title: August 2024
items.text: Updated my portfolio. I decided to change stacks, moving from React to Svelte. A bit of freshness, more performance, accessibility, internationalization, and a better user experience.

items.title: Today
items.text: My internship at Radio France ends at the end of September. I am preparing my move to Valencia, Spain, and looking for a full-stack developer position working remotely, starting in early October.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Did you enjoy my presentation and want to work with me? Contact me by email or via my social networks.

footer.text: Made with Svelte and love by Baptiste Dauphouy.
